newsitem.title: GERMANY: German Bund futures higher, survive profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: German Bund futures higher, survive profit-taking.

text.p: German Bunds remained higher in late trade, surviving bouts of profit taking brought on by a 70 basis point rally since Tuesday morning.

Traders said strong U.S. Treasuries, supported by the outcome of the U.S. presidental election, lifted Bunds which closely tracked their U.S. counterparts after several sessions of underperforming them.
The December Bund future was up 14 basis points in late trade to 100.32 after trading as high as 100.47 not long after the market opened.
The Bund/T-note spread was steady at 46 basis points late in the day, recovering from earlier losses relative to U.S. debt.
The yield curve, which has been flattening, steepened because of what one analyst said was a technical rebound.
The release of the European Monetary Institute convergence report which said EU states were dragging their heels on getting their public finances in order had little lasting impact on Bunds.
Analysts said the report contained few surprises.
